intro: Calonemorchis interjacens, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, attracting various pollinators. Calonemorchis interjacens is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
